# Affinity API Documentation

> llms.txt format - Index of API documentation for Large Language Models and AI agents.
>
> This file provides links to comprehensive API documentation in markdown format.
> For more information about the llms.txt format, see: https://langchain-ai.github.io/langgraph/llms-txt-overview/

---

## Documentation Files

### API v1 Documentation (Legacy)
- [Affinity API v1 Documentation](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/yaniv-golan/affinity-api-docs/main/docs/v1/affinity_api_docs.md): Complete API documentation for Affinity API v1. Includes authentication (Basic Auth and Bearer Token), all endpoints (List, Person, Organization, Opportunity, Interaction, Note, Webhook, etc.), request/response formats, rate limits, common use cases, and code examples.

### API v2 Documentation (Current)
- Coming soon - Planned for future implementation

---

## Repository Information

- **Repository**: https://github.com/yaniv-golan/affinity-api-docs
- **Official v1 Documentation**: https://api-docs.affinity.co/
- **Official v2 Documentation**: https://developer.affinity.co/
- **Last Updated**: 2025-11-08

---

## Important Notes

⚠️ **This is an UNOFFICIAL markdown copy of the Affinity API documentation.**

The official and authoritative documentation is maintained by Affinity. Always refer to the official documentation for the most up-to-date and accurate information.

---

## Usage

For AI coding assistants and LLMs:
- Follow the links above to access the full documentation
- The markdown format is optimized for AI parsing
- All content is available via raw GitHub URLs

For IDEs (Cursor, Windsurf, Claude):
- Add this file as custom documentation
- The IDE will automatically fetch linked content
- Supports RAG and chunking strategies
- Can be used with MCP servers like [mcpdoc](https://github.com/langchain-ai/mcpdoc)
